results.title: In Between. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Kim Dalton and Mandy Smith
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “In Between” a series of dramas set in Melbourne that looks at the pressures of growing up. Episode Three looks at Angie who is bright, tough and enjoys life. However, life is suddenly more complicated when she discovers that she is pregnant. Episode Four is about Alex who is confused by the different pressures that his father and friends place upon him to grow up.

results.title: In Between. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Kim Dalton, Mandy Smith and Chris Dalton
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “In Between” a series of dramas set in Melbourne that looks at the pressures of growing up. Episode One is about Fatima who wants to be a journalist. However, her father believes that Fatima should leave school and return to Turkey to an arranged marriage. Episode Two is about Saret who is an illegal immigrant from Cambodia.

results.title: In between
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Kim Dalton and Mandy Smith
results.brief_description: A mini series of four one-hour episodes, each of which concentrates primarly on one of the four major characters (Fatima, Saret, Angie and Alex) but also, advances the stories of three other characters. We learn of their relationships with friends and neighbours,their families and their workplaces.

results.title: In balance
results.brief_description: Two brothers who are partners in a fishing boat business discuss how the profits of their partnership should be managed and from this discussion two points of view emerge. Others enter into the argument and present illustrations of a balanced management of profits. The film describes various ways in which the profits of a company may be used presenting views of employees, shareholders and management.

results.title: In all weathers
results.creator_credit: R.K. Neilson Baxter, Basic Films and John Rhodes
results.brief_description: One of the greatest hazards in marine navigation, poor visibility, has in the past caused much loss of time, money and often life. Before the advent of radar the problem was without solution. This film explains the history of radar, the difficulties faced and overcome in its adaption to marine operation, and finally its inestimable value as a navigational aid.

results.title: In all seasons
results.creator_credit: Desmond Dew, ONF | NFB and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: The Atmospheric Environment Service (AES) is Canada’s weather bureau. The AES supplies weather forecasts and information on climate patterns. Our well-being depends on a knowledge of the weather. This film shows the AES in operation in a country where there are “four seasons - every week.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Desmond Dew, ONF | NFB and Ernest Reid

results.title: In a fishing port
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, ABC-TV (Australia), Jean Richards and Frank L. Few
results.brief_description:
Shows a few days in the life of a daughter of a Port Franklin flounder fisherman, showing her at school, horse riding in the bush and helping her father in his fishing boat to lay nets and sort, clean and pack the fish.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: In a Box
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Eliot Noyes
results.brief_description: A short animated film of line drawings suggesting the predicament of people who find themselves boxed in by life. It takes only a few deft strokes of the animator’s pen to show how people’s lives are limited by their own view of things. The box they are in may not fit; it may be uncomfortable in many ways, but they rush back to its familiarity, if not security, even though brief sorties outside may show them a bigger world. (Awards: Columbus; Rome)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Eliot Noyes

results.title: Imran Khan
results.creator_credit: John E. Bodnar and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Imran Khan, the Tiger of Pakistan, was born into a famous cricketing family and became the most inspirational cricketer of his generation. From his early days at Oxford to his full test career with Pakistan, he has experienced unparralleled success as a genuine all-rounder. His test career, spanning three decades, has seen him develop from a precocious talent to a father-like figure exuding respect and experience. Features highlights of his playing career including his many records and achievements.

results.title: Impunidad
results.creator_credit: Cam Productions, SBS-TV, Film Victoria and Helen Gaynor
results.brief_description: Impunidad, impunity n. “exemption from punishment”. In 1954 a CIA-backed military coup toppled the democratic government in Guatemala allowing full control by the Army over the citizens of Guatemala. During the 1960’s and 1970’s a guerilla movement established itself throughout large areas of the country-side, and in the late 70’s the Army took on a “scorched earth policy” destroying 440 villages, with 100,000 civilians murdered and 45,000 missing. In a land shrouded in silence where 2.1% of the population own 72% of arable land, 86% live in poverty and 1,000,000 are internally displaced, Australian filmmaker, Helen Gaynor, worked undercover to reveal the continuing violence between the armed forces and the indigenous peoples, the terror and corruption which still allows the army to continue acting with impunity. 65% of the 10 million population are indigenous Mayan Indians, and despite 500 years of oppression, many facets of their culture survives. Though fewer in number, the disappearances, torture and massacres are still occurring today. Narrated by Jenny Seedsman In English and Spanish with English subtitles.
